The quality assurance metric is represented by the width of the bars and is calculated as the number of quality-related incidents divided by the total production volume. The safety metric is represented by the depth of the bars and is calculated as the total number of accidents divided by the total hours worked. The environmental impact metric is represented by the color of the bars and is calculated as the amount of CO2 emissions divided by total volume of production output.

By comparing the performance of the different factories in terms of these metrics, it is possible to identify and prioritize areas where improvement is needed in order to achieve better overall production line performance.
